level.heading: Possession or transfer of one ounce or less of marijuana.

level.text: Notwithstanding any other District law, the possession or transfer without remuneration of marijuana weighing one ounce or less shall constitute a civil violation.
A violation of subsection (a) of this section shall not constitute a criminal offense or a delinquent act as defined in § 16-2301(7).
The possession of paraphernalia associated with a violation of subsection (a) of this section shall not constitute a violation of § 48-1103.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 20-126
level.text: Law 20-126, the "Marijuana Possession Decriminalization Amendment Act of 2014," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-409. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 4, 2014, and March 4, 2014, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 31, 2014, it was assigned Act No. 20-305 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-126 became effective on July 17, 2014.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Section 501 of D.C. Law 20-126 provided that the Mayor, pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of Title 2 [§ 2-501 et seq.], may issue rules to implement the provisions of the act.
